bunpro.meaning: It would be nice if, It would be good if, Should, I hope
bunpro.writeup: When any of theconjunction particlesthat carry the meaning of 'if' (たら,ば, orと) are paired with theい-Adjective,いい, they will express the desired result of the speaker. These all translate to 'it would be nice if (A)'. However, the speaker's level of certainty about the result being 'good' will change slightly, depending on the particle.ばいい- Hypothetically, (A) happening would be good. (Lowest strength/certainty)たらいい- When (A) happens, it will be good. (Medium strength/certainty)といい- The result of (A) is good. (Strongest/most certain)To useば,たら, orといい, first add the conjunction particle to the end of any verb, and then attach theい-Adjective,いい.

examples.japanese: 明日までに届けばいいんだけど、多分届かないと思う。
examples.english: It would be good if it gets delivered by tomorrow, but I don't think it will.

examples.japanese: 私もあんなに早く走れたらいいな。
examples.english: It would be nice if I could also run that fast.

examples.japanese: 来年は海外旅行に行けるといいね。
examples.english: It would be nice if we could travel abroad next year, right?

examples.japanese: 日本語を上手にしゃべれるようになりたかったら、日本人としゃべったらいい。
examples.english: You should speak to Japanese people if you want to improve your Japanese conversational ability. (it would be good if...)

examples.japanese: 毎日、好きな番組が見れたらいい。
examples.english: It would be nice if I could watch my favorite TV show everyday.

examples.japanese: 自由にしたらいいでしょう。
examples.english: It would be nice to just do whatever you want, wouldn't it?

examples.japanese: 明日と明後日も晴れるといいですね。
examples.english: It would be nice if the weather was clear tomorrow and the day after, wouldn't it?

examples.japanese: 文句を言わないで！どうしたらいいのか教えてよ。
examples.english: Stop complaining! Tell me what would be good to do!
